text: Roelof Frederik "Pik" Botha, DMS (27 April 1932 - 12 October 2018) was a South African politician. He served as the country's foreign minister in the last years of the apartheid era. Botha was nicknamed 'Pik' (short for pikkewyn, Afrikaans for 'penguin') because of a perceived likeness to a penguin in his stance, accentuated when he wore a suit.A smart penguin, Geoffrey Wheatcroft, The Spectator, 7 April 1984, page 9 In 2000, Botha declared his support for Presidents Nelson Mandela and Thabo Mbeki.BBC Question Time in South Africa: Who's Who, The Daily Telegraph, 12 December 2013 Botha died on 12 October 2018 at his home in Pretoria at the age of 86. ==References== ==Other websites== * South African History Online * South African Who's Who Category:1932 births Category:2018 deaths Category:People associated with Apartheid Category:South African politicians
